title: Is Your Wealth Adviser Independent? Sometimes, It Isnâ€™t Easy to Tell
sub_head: Investors might not be aware when their advisers have ties to insurance companies
body: Since the 2008 financial crisis tarnished big Wall Street banks and brokers, the ranks of independent wealth advisers have grown faster than other categories. Enhancing their appeal has been a standard known as the fiduciary rule, which legally requires such advisers to put client interests first at all times and generally avoid conflicts of interest.
